bill_title: make an appropriation for rural access infrastructure improvements and to declare an emergency.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to create the rural access infrastructure fund, to provide for the use and distribution of the fund, make an appropriation, and to declare an emergency. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-1. Definition. For the purposes of this Act, the term, small structure, means any small bridge or culvert with an opening of sixteen square feet or more. Section 2. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-2. Rural access infrastructure fund. There is hereby created in the state treasury the rural access infrastructure fund. Any general funds appropriated to the rural access infrastructure program shall be transferred into the rural access infrastructure fund. Interest on the money in the fund shall be deposited into the fund. Section 3. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-3. Rural access infrastructure fund--Distribution to counties. Before August first of each year for three years, starting in 2021, the Department of Revenue shall distribute the sum of three million dollars of the rural access infrastructure fund to each county based on the calculated allocation as follows: County % Allocation Aurora 0.8978% Beadle 1.5275% Bennett 0.3350% Bon Homme 0.3350% Brookings 2.8273% Brown 1.5543% Brule 0.3350% Buffalo 0.3350% Butte 2.8273% Campbell 0.3350% Charles Mix 2.1573% Clark 0.5360% Clay 1.9831% Codington 1.6481% Corson 1.0586% Custer 1.1792% Davison 0.7638% Day 1.5007% Deuel 3.0819% Dewey 0.3350% Douglas 0.9112% Edmunds 1.5543% Fall River 0.5896% Faulk 0.3350% Grant 3.4035% Gregory 1.2059% Haakon 0.3350% Hamlin 2.0367% Hand 2.7201% Hanson 0.6432% Harding 1.6615% Hughes 0.7638% Hutchinson 4.4352% Hyde 0.7906% Jackson 0.3350% Jerauld 1.7687% Jones 0.3350% Kingsbury 1.6079% Lake 2.3449% Lawrence 0.6700% Lincoln 4.7166% Lyman 1.1658% Marshall 1.4739% McCook 3.5643% McPherson 0.4556% Meade 0.9112% Mellette 0.3350% Miner 3.2293% Minnehaha 5.3598% Moody 1.5811% Oglala Lakota 0.3350% Pennington 2.3583% Perkins 0.6566% Potter 0.3618% Roberts 3.0149% Sanborn 1.4069% Spink 0.3618% Stanley 0.3350% Sully 0.3350% Todd 0.3350% Tripp 0.5762% Turner 4.1270% Union 1.5543% Walworth 0.3350% Yankton 5.6680% Ziebach 1.4471% A county receiving a distribution under this section shall utilize five percent of the distribution on roads within any organized township in that county. Section 4. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-4. Rural access infrastructure fund--Formula for distribution of balance of fund. Before August first of each year, beginning in 2024, the Department of Revenue shall distribute the balance of the rural access infrastructure fund to each county based on the allocation calculated in accordance with § 31-34-3. This percentage is calculated by using the total number of small structures in a county divided by the sum of all small structures in the state, multiplied by one hundred. Each county that receives funds from the rural access infrastructure program shall use the funds in accordance with the provisions of this Act. Section 5. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-5. Deposit of excess funds into state highway fund. The total amount allowed to be held by the county is equal to four times the current amount being distributed. If the annual distribution received would cause any county's rural access infrastructure fund to exceed the maximum amount allowed, the excess shall be deposited into the state highway fund. Section 6. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-6. Distribution and use of funds by county. Each county shall establish a rural access infrastructure fund for the deposit of funds received pursuant to this Act. The funds shall be distributed by the board of county commissioners for only the following expenses: (1) Construction or replacement of small structures located in townships complying with the requirements of this Act; (2) Construction or replacement of small structures described in a county highway and bridge improvement plan that are located on county secondary highways; and (3) Engineering, hydrological studies, planning, materials, and other costs as necessary to complete the projects. Section 7. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-7. Rural access infrastructure fund--Application process. Applications for use of rural access infrastructure funds shall be submitted to the board of county commissioners on or before July fifteenth on forms prescribed by the association of county commissioners. The board of county commissioners shall approve disbursement of the funds no later than September first. Applications from townships shall be accompanied by a resolution approved by the township board of supervisors authorizing the application and any funding commitments made by the township. The township share shall be a minimum of twenty percent of the funds. Applications for county secondary highways shall be submitted by the county highway superintendent. Section 8. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-8. Rural access infrastructure grants--Criteria. The board of county commissioners shall consider the following criteria in awarding rural access infrastructure grants: (1) Traffic use of the highway; (2) Public safety; (3) Residential, commercial, recreational, and other uses of the highway; (4) Cost of the project; (5) Length of detour if the project is not completed; (6) Number of residences, farms, and ranches served by the project; (7) Contribution from township or others to the project; (8) If the project is located on a fully maintained road; (9) If the highway does not terminate into a field entrance, driveway, single residence, farm, or ranch; (10) The application, or group of applications, that best serves the citizens of this state; and (11) Any other matters deemed applicable by the board of county commissioners. Section 9. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-9. Rural access infrastructure funds--Requirements for use. A requesting township shall timely file the township small structure improvement plan pursuant to § 31-34-10 with the county highway superintendent in order to be eligible for the funds. Any township requesting use of rural access infrastructure funds pursuant to this Act shall meet at least one of the following requirements: (1) Impose an annual property tax levy of fifty cents per thousand pursuant to § 10-12-28.2; (2) Impose an annual tax levy of five thousand dollars or more; or (3) Impose a tax levy opt out pursuant to § 10-13-36. Section 10. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-10. Township small structure improvement plan. To be eligible to receive funding from the rural access infrastructure fund established under this Act, a township shall, each year by July fifteenth, submit to the county that township is located in, a small structure improvement plan and any updates shall be made in accordance with this section. The secondary road small structure improvement plan shall include: (1) One or more maps showing the location of all small structures within the township; (2) The location, width, and length of each small structure; (3) A report on the condition of each small structure; (4) Whether the small structure is posted for load capacity, and if so, what the posted limit is; and (5) A list of all projects proposed to be undertaken by the township over the next five years including the location of the project, type of project, source of funding for the project, estimated cost of the project, and the year the project is proposed to be completed. Section 11. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-11. Rural access infrastructure funds--Use. The county commission may use rural access infrastructure funds for the replacement or repair of small structures on county secondary highways so long as such projects are considered in a similar manner as the small structures that are located within an organized township. Section 12. The state treasurer shall transfer from the general fund the sum of $9,000,000 to the rural access infrastructure fund, for purposes of providing for the construction or replacement of any small structures located on the township highways and county secondary highways in South Dakota. Section 13. There is hereby appropriated the sum of $9,000,000 in other fund expenditure authority to the Department of Revenue to distribute the calculation as provided by section 3 of this Act. Section 14. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2022, shall revert in accordance with the procedures prescribed in chapter 4-8. Section 15. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval.

An Act to make an appropriation for rural access infrastructure improvements and to declare an emergency. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-1. Definition. For the purposes of this Act, the term, small structure, means any small bridge or culvert with an opening of sixteen square feet or more located on a township road or county secondary road, excluding bridges as defined in § 31-14-1. Section 2. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-2. Rural access infrastructure program--Distribution. Before August 1, 2021, the Department of Revenue shall distribute the sum of three million dollars on a pro rata basis to each county for the purpose of planning and completing an inventory of small structures as prescribed by the Department of Transportation. Before August first of each year for two years, starting in 2022, the Department of Revenue shall distribute the sum of three million dollars to each county based on the allocation calculated in accordance with this section for the purposes described in § 31-34-3. Each county's allocated percentage is calculated by using the total number of small structures on township roads and county secondary roads located in a county divided by the sum of all small structures on township roads and county secondary roads in the state as reported to the Department of Transportation, multiplied by one hundred. Each county that receives funds from this rural access infrastructure program shall use the funds in accordance with the provisions of this Act. Section 3. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-3. Distribution and use of funds by county. Each county shall establish a rural access infrastructure fund for the deposit of funds received pursuant to this Act. The funds shall be distributed by the board of county commissioners for only the following expenses: (1) Engineering, hydrological studies, planning, materials, and other costs as necessary to plan for and complete the projects; (2) Construction, rehabilitation, or replacement of small structures located in townships complying with the requirements of this Act; (3) Construction, rehabilitation, or replacement of small structures described in a county highway and bridge improvement plan that are located on county secondary highways. The fund may not be used on no maintenance roads or minimum maintenance roads. Section 4. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-4. County rural access infrastructure fund--Application process. Applications for use of funds allocated pursuant to this Act shall be submitted to the board of county commissioners on or before January fifteenth on forms prescribed by the association of county commissioners. The board of county commissioners shall award the funds no later than March fifteenth. Applications from townships shall be accompanied by a resolution approved by the township board of supervisors authorizing the application and any funding commitments made by the township. The township or county share shall be a minimum of twenty percent of the funds necessary to complete the project. Applications for county secondary highways shall be submitted by the county highway superintendent. Section 5. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-5. Rural access infrastructure grants--Criteria. The board of county commissioners shall, at a minimum, consider the following criteria in awarding rural access infrastructure grants: (1) Traffic use of the highway; (2) Public safety; (3) Residential, commercial, recreational, and other uses of the highway; (4) Cost of the project; (5) Length of detour if the project is not completed; (6) Number of residences, farms, and ranches served by the project; (7) Contribution from township or others to the project and ability of township to fund the project without utilizing the rural access infrastructure fund; (8) Confirmation the project is not located on a no maintenance or minimum maintenance road; (9) Hydrological impact; (10) If the highway does not terminate into a field entrance, driveway, single residence, farm, or ranch; (11) The application, or group of applications, that best serves the citizens of this state; and (12) Any other matters deemed applicable by the board of county commissioners. The decisions of the county commissioner shall be final and nonappealable. However, a denied application may be submitted in a subsequent year. Section 6. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-6. Rural access infrastructure funds--Requirements for use. A requesting township shall timely file the township small structure improvement plan pursuant to § 31-34-7 with the county highway superintendent and an annual report pursuant to § 8-10-30 in order to be eligible for the funds. Any township requesting use of rural access infrastructure funds pursuant to this Act shall meet at least one of the following requirements: (1) Impose an annual property tax levy of fifty cents per thousand pursuant to § 10-12-28.2; or (2) Impose a tax levy opt out pursuant to § 10-13-36. Section 7. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-7. Rural access infrastructure funds--Requirements for use. To be eligible to receive funding from the rural access infrastructure fund established under this Act, a township shall, each year by November fifteenth, submit to the county that township is located in, a small structure improvement plan and any updates shall be made in accordance with this section. The township road small structure plan shall include: (1) One or more maps showing the location of all small structures within the township; (2) The location, width, and length of each small structure; (3) A report on the condition of each small structure; (4) Whether the small structure is posted for load capacity, and if so, what the posted limit is; (5) A list of all projects proposed to be undertaken by the township over the next five years including the location of the project, type of project, source of funding for the project, estimated cost of the project, and the year the project is proposed to be completed; and (6) Such additional items as may be prescribed by the Department of Transportation. Section 8. That a NEW SECTION be added: 31-34-8. County rural access infrastructure funds--Use. The county commission may use rural access infrastructure funds for the construction, rehabilitation, or replacement of small structures on county secondary highways so long as such projects are considered in a similar manner as the small structures that are located within an organized township. Section 9. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of $9,000,000 to the Department of Revenue for the purpose of distribution to county rural access infrastructure funds. Section 10. The commissioner of the Department of Revenue shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 11. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated shall revert in accordance with the procedures prescribed in chapter 4-8. Section 12. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval.
